name: Newscatcher
description: API to find news articles by any topic, country, language, website, or keyword

api_methods.name: /v1/aggregation
api_methods.description: Searches as `/v1/search` but returns the articles count per hour or day instead of articles' data

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search for. Has to be [URL-encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding).

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country to which you want to narrow your search. This parameter is [experimental]. We advise you to use it in conjunction with the `lang` parameter. Accepts any [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) codes

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
The topic to which you want to restrict the articles of your choice. This parameter is [experimental]. Accepted values are `news`, `sport`, `tech`, `world`, `finance`, `politics`, `business`, `economics`, `entertainment`,`beauty`,`travel`,`music`,`food`,`science`
- `news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example, `topic=sport`

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description:
One or more news resources to filter your search. It should be the normal form of the URL, for example, **[nytimes.com](http://nytimes.com/)**, **[theguardian.com](http://theguardian.com/)**
> Comma separated string, for example `sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

parameters.name: agg_by
parameters.description:
- `day` — default option. Aggregate results by day. No more than 100 days 
- `hour` — Aggregate results by hour. No more than 100 hours

parameters.name: to_rank
parameters.description: Upper boundary of the rank of news website to filter by

parameters.name: media
parameters.description:
Adds to the output of the call two more variables: `media` and `media_content`

Media - the main image published with an article 

media_content  - a comma-separated string of all images used in an article

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
`af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`,`cn`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`, `pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`,`tw`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`. 
Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

parameters.name: not_sources
parameters.description:
One or more sources to be excluded from the search. 
> Comma separated string, for example, `not_sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Until which point in time to search for. The default timezone is UTC

parameters.name: ranked_only
parameters.description: Limit the search only for the sources which are in top 1 million online websites. Defaults to `True` (`False` if you want to turn it off). Unranked sources are assigned a rank that equals to `999999`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
From which point in time to start the search. No specific format is required. E.g. (`2020/05/01`, `2020-05-01` ,`2020-05-01 12:54:14`, `2020-05-01 4:15am`, `yesterday 2:02 am`, `2020/05/01 12:55 EST`) Default timezone is UTC. **
The default is set to one week ago at midnight UTC.**

parameters.name: search_in
parameters.description: By default, we search what you specified in `q` in both `title` and `summary` of the article. However, you can limit this to either `title` or `summary`

parameters.name: from_rank
parameters.description: Lowest boundary of the rank of news website to filter by. **Important**: lower rank means that a source is more popular

api_methods.name: /v1/latest_headlines
api_methods.description: Always returns the latest 100 articles for any `topic`, `country`, `lang`, or any of those combined

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
`af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`,`cn`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`, `pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`,`tw`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`. 
 Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
The topic to which you want to restrict the articles of your choice. This parameter is [experimental]. Accepted values are `news`, `sport`, `tech`, `world`, `finance`, `politics`, `business`, `economics`, `entertainment`,`beauty`,`travel`,`music`,`food`,`science`
- `news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example `topic=sport`

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country to which you want to narrow your search. This parameter is [experimental]. We advise you to use it in conjunction with the `lang` parameter. Accepts any [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) codes

parameters.name: media
parameters.description:
Adds to the output of the call two more variables: `media` and `media_content`

Media - the main image published with an article 

media_content  - a comma-separated string of all images used in an article

api_methods.name: /v1/search_free
api_methods.description:
**Up to 100 articles per 1 API call even with free Basic Plan.**
Free search. Only the language filter is allowed.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search for. Has to be [URL-encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding)

parameters.name: media
parameters.description:
Adds to the output of the call two more variables: `media` and `media_content`

Media - the main image published with an article 

media_content  - a comma-separated string of all images used in an article

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page. Use it to scroll through the results. Defaults to 1

parameters.name: ranked_only
parameters.description: Limit the search only for the sources which are in top 1 million online websites. Defaults to `True` (`False` if you want to turn it off). Unranked sources are assigned a rank that equals to `999999`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: How many articles to return per page. Defaults to 50, max is 100

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
`af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`,`cn`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`, `pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`,`tw`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`. 
Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

api_methods.name: /v1/search
api_methods.description: Highly customizable search through our database. All filters and sorting options are allowed.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search for. Has to be [URL-encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding)

parameters.name: not_sources
parameters.description:
One or more sources to be excluded from the search. 
> Comma separated string, for example `not_sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
`af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`,`cn`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`, `pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`,`tw`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`. 
Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

parameters.name: search_in
parameters.description: By default, we search what you specified in `q` in both `title` and `summary` of the article. However, you can limit this to either `title` or `summary`

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
- `relevancy` — the most relevant results first, 
- `date` — the most recently published results first, 
- `rank` — the results from the highest-ranked sources first

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description:
One or more news resources to filter your search. It should be the normal form of the URL, for example, **[nytimes.com](http://nytimes.com/)**, **[theguardian.com](http://theguardian.com/)**
> Comma separated string, for example `sources=nytimes.com,cnn.com,wsj.com`

parameters.description: Until which point in time to search for. The default timezone is UTC

`news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example `topic=sport`

parameters.name: from_rank
parameters.description: Lowest boundary of the rank of news website to filter by. **Important**: lower rank means that a source is more popular

parameters.name: to_rank
parameters.description: Upper boundary of the rank of news website to filter by

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: How many articles to return per page. Defaults to 50, max is 100. Not included in Basic plan.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of the page. Use it to scroll through the results. Defaults to 1

parameters.name: ranked_only
parameters.description: Limit the search only for the sources which are in top 1 million online websites. Defaults to `True` (`False` if you want to turn it off). Unranked sources are assigned a rank that equals to `999999`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
From which point in time to start the search. No specific format is required. 
E.g. (`2020/05/01`, `2020-05-01` ,`2020-05-01 12:54:14`, `2020-05-01 4:15am`, `yesterday 2:02 am`, `2020/05/01 12:55 EST`) .
The default timezone is UTC. **Defaults to one week ago at midnight UTC.**

api_methods.name: /v1/search_enterprise
api_methods.description: Highly customizable search through our database. All filters and sorting options are allowed.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search for. Has to be [URL-encoded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding)

parameters.name: link_begins_with
parameters.description:
Filter on the prefix of the URL. 
For example: `https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/25/business` will give you all the articles for the exact date for **business** subject. 
Be aware that every news website has its own structure. Use this parameter only if you want to be precise in your search. In all other cases, use parameters that we provide you for deep search like `topic`, `from`, `to` etc.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
- `relevancy` — the most relevant results first, 
- `date` — the most recently published results first, 
- `rank` — the results from the highest-ranked sources first

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
The topic to which you want to restrict the articles of your choice. This parameter is [experimental]. Accepted values are `news`, `sport`, `tech`, `world`, `finance`, `politics`, `business`, `economics`, `entertainment`,`beauty`,`travel`,`music`,`food`,`science`
`news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example `topic=sport`

parameters.description: Until which point in time to search for. The default timezone is UTC

parameters.name: to_rank
parameters.description: Upper boundary of the rank of news website to filter by

parameters.name: from_rank
parameters.description: Lowest boundary of the rank of news website to filter by. **Important**: lower rank means that a source is more popular

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:

api_methods.name: /v1/sources
api_methods.description: Returns a list of supported news websites for any topic, country, language, or any of those combined

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the search.  Allowed values are:
`af`, `ar`, `bg`, `bn`, `ca`,`cn`, `cs`, `cy`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fa`, `fi`, `fr`, `gu`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `it`, `ja`, `kn`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `mk`, `ml`, `mr`, `ne`, `nl`, `no`, `pa`, `pl`, `pt`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `so`, `sq`, `sv`, `sw`, `ta`, `te`, `th`, `tl`, `tr`,`tw`, `uk`, `ur`, `vi`. 
 Specifying the language will make your search more relevant

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
The topic to which you want to restrict the articles of your choice. This parameter is [experimental]. Accepted values are `news`, `sport`, `tech`, `world`, `finance`, `politics`, `business`, `economics`, `entertainment`,`beauty`,`travel`,`music`,`food`,`science`
- `news` usually means a general news feed (main headlines of a website).
> Important: this parameter is [experimental]. Not all news articles are assigned with a `topic`, therefore, we cannot guarantee that 100% of topics talking about technology will be assigned a `tech` label.
> One topic at a time, for example, `topic=sport`

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country to which you want to narrow your search. This parameter is [experimental]. We advise you to use it in conjunction with the `lang` parameter. Accepts any [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) codes

constraints.inter-dependency: country, lang: It is advised to use the country parameter in conjunction with the lang parameter.
